TopicTitle: TweakScale FATAL ERROR on Tweak Scale Everything mod

Articles.Content:
I just installed the TweakScale - Rescale Everything! mod, and as the title says, after the game and all of my mods have been loaded, it's giving me the error "[TweakScale]ERROR: FATAL". It's saying that there's 7 total fatal errors. I'm new to the game and modding it, so I'm not exactly sure on how to fix this. If anybody can help or who has had this problem before, I would very much appreciate it! I'll attach a screenshot of what it's saying, along with the KSP.log for reference. Thanks again!

KSP.log    https://drive.google.com/open?id=1QyjtdbdVurk8XkGB0mb_6r9JULjiPixw

Error Screenshot    https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Da4-yZvwgqjfkKI_C9yeepPy6izYPVWs

8 minutes ago, trekkie88 said:

I just installed the TweakScale - Rescale Everything! mod, and as the title says, after the game and all of my mods have been loaded, it's giving me the error "[TweakScale]ERROR: FATAL". It's saying that there's 7 total fatal errors. I'm new to the game and modding it, so I'm not exactly sure on how to fix this. If anybody can help or who has had this problem before, I would very much appreciate it! I'll attach a screenshot of what it's saying, along with the KSP.log for reference. Thanks again!

KSP.log    https://drive.google.com/open?id=1QyjtdbdVurk8XkGB0mb_6r9JULjiPixw

Error Screenshot    https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Da4-yZvwgqjfkKI_C9yeepPy6izYPVWs

 You should post in the tweak scale thread not by yourself so that other people can see and respond

LGG is right, I just got this by accident as the words TweakScale and FATAL popped on the activities steam at the time I was here.

Well, since we are already here, let's crack this nut. I downloaded your KSP.log, and found this: 

[LOG 15:57:57.961] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part MEMLander (non RO (RP-0 yes) - Munar Excursion Module (M.E.M.)) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.965] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTInlineAirIntake (XM-600 1.25m Air Intake) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.966] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTWingSmall (non RO (RP-0 yes) - Mk0B Small Modular Wing) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.966] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTWingLarge (non RP-0 - FAT-460 Super-Lift Aeroplane Main Wing) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.970] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTOsaulNoseCockpitAn225 (An-124 Cockpit) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.971] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTOsualRadCockpit (An-124 Cockpit Radial) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).
[LOG 15:57:57.982] [TweakScale] ERROR: **FATAL** Part SXTtruckbox (non RP-0 - Truck Box) has a fatal problem due having duplicated properties - see issue [#34]( https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/34 ).

So I took the parts affected and gone for the patching logs:

And the others parts followed suit. I think there's something new on SXT patches? We had already figured out one or two glitches from it a year ago (IIRC). But I found this on the log: 

[LOG 15:51:27.385] Applying update SXT/Patches/ModCompatibility/SXT_TweakScale/@PART[SXTInlineAirIntake]:NEEDS[TweakScale] to SXT/Parts/Aviation/Aero/airIntake/part2.cfg/PART[SXTInlineAirIntake]
[LOG 15:51:28.235] Applying update SXT/Patches/ModCompatibility/SXT_TweakScale/@PART[SXTInlineAirIntake]:NEEDS[TweakScale] to SXT/Parts/Aviation/Aero/airIntake/part2.cfg/PART[SXTInlineAirIntake]

What tells me that SXT/Patches/ModCompatibility/SXT_TweakScale.cfg is being applied twice - the glitch we have fixed in the past.

Are you sure you are using the latest SXT? I found this on the log: 

[LOG 15:51:32.657] MiniAVC -> C:\Users\mcall\Desktop\Realistic Kerbal Space Program\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\SXT\SXTContinued.version

But the latest SXT is 0.3.29. I also noticed that you are using KSP 1.6.1, and the latest SXT for it is 0.3.26. Since you are using 0.3.27, theoretically made for KSP 1.7, I think it's safe to update to 0.3.28.2, the latest that works to 1.7.3, and this version has the fixes we had applied to it last year that solve this Houston you got.

some bad whitespacing
Since I am using version 1.6.1, and the latest SXT for 1.6.1 is version 0.3.26, do I install that version, or the 0.3.28.2 version? Would the latter still be compatible with 1.6.1?

2 hours ago, trekkie88 said:

Since I am using version 1.6.1, and the latest SXT for 1.6.1 is version 0.3.26, do I install that version, or the 0.3.28.2 version? Would the latter still be compatible with 1.6.1?

I think it worths a try. Since you area already using a SXT version theoretically made for 1.7.0, I think you have pretty good chances to walk away from the stunt.

Please try it and check, If the thing borks on you, call me here and I will cook a "HotFix" for you.

("HotFixes" are brute force patching that I write to brute force fixing Add'Ons when a fix is not available - it's a bit cumbersome, it's better to try a fixed version of the faulty Add'On first, but at least we have a fallback measure when the worst happens).

2 hours ago, trekkie88 said:

I just uninstalled the SXT version that I did have and installed the 0.3.28.2 version, and it's no longer giving me the fatal error message. But, it's now saying that 25 things failed the sanity check. Is that normal, or am I missing something?

I have good news, and annoying news.

Good news: your instalment is safe to go.

Annoying news: there're some thingies that need to be fixed on TweakScale and perhaps some other add'ons. On at least one situation (ModulePartVariant with mass), it's something I need to find the time to implement on TS. On some others, I still need to investigate.

So TweakScale had to withdrawn itself from these parts, as without proper support Krakens will be released over your savegame. This means that the parts are there, good to be used - but you can't scale that 20 (I checked, it's 20!  ) parts.

You can proceed without fear, your game is good to go. Yellow Warnings are things that you are not going to like, but other than that nothing bad will happen on new savegames.

Only Red Warnings (Houstons) are serious and can damage something.

But there's a gotcha: old savegames and old crafts that have that 20 parts scaled will suffer from this - it's nothing I can help, because by allowing these parts to be scaled as we are now will, surely, damage your savegame sooner or later (and I never managed to fix a savegame after things started to explode due the Zero Mass problem - the problem that happens when these parts are scaled and are hit by that problems I need to locate and fix).
Okay, thank you for your help and time. I'm glad that it's nothing to be alarmed about, and that the game is safe to play.
